title: Mouser's Scalpel
data:
| )   Mouser's Scalpel   *(No tile)*    |                                      |
| ------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------ |
| Base item                             | [rapier](/wiki/Rapier "Rapier")      |
|                                       |                                      |
| Damage vs. small                      | 1d6 **+1** + *(special)*             |
| Damage vs. large                      | 1d8 **+1** + *(special)*             |
| To-hit bonus                          | +5                                   |
| Bonus versus                          | *(any)*                              |
|                                       |                                      |
| Weapon skill                          | [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber")         |
| Size                                  | one-handed                           |
| Affiliation                           | - [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") |
|                                       |                                      |
| When carried                          | *(none)*                             |
| When wielded                          | *(none)*                             |
| When [invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") | *(none)*                             |
|                                       |                                      |
| Base price                            | 600 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")    |
| Weight                                | [40](/wiki/Weight "Weight")          |
| Material                              | [metal](/wiki/Metal "Metal")         |

**Mouser's Scalpel** is an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") that appears in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") for wishing purposes, and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is a [rapier](/wiki/Rapier "Rapier").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Average damage calculation](#Average_damage_calculation)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 Origin](#Origin)
- [5 References](#References)

## Description

The Mouser's Scalpel grants +5 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and +1 damage, and has a unique mechanic that allows it to deliver extra "attacks" on each hit: these extra attacks deal +1d8 + 1 + \<enchantment> to all monsters. Each hit has an initial 1⁄5 chance of delivering one of these extra blows, followed by a 5⁄11 chance of subsequent additional hits, applied repeatedly until this chance is missed.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Strategy

The chance for extra blows to stack means that in theory, the wielder may be lucky enough to continually strike a foe indefinitely until they are killed.

### Average damage calculation

The average damage calculations in the following table do not include bonuses from [weapon skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill"), [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), or from using a [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") weapon against [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") or [demons](/wiki/M2_DEMON "M2 DEMON").

Given unique nature of the added hits, we first need to find the expected number of hits per swing of the weapon. Given that the initial bonus strike has a 4⁄5 chance of no hits, a 1⁄5 chance of occurring the first hit, and the probability ***p*** on subsequent hits after that, we can write the equation as:

| Expected number of hits                                                                                                     |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ![0\*80%+(1+\frac{1}{1-p})\*20%=(1+\frac{11}{6})\*20%=\bold{0.57}](/images/math/7/9/3/7936a3199671acdcb43001ae53f7104e.png) |

With this we can then calculate the expected amount of damage from the proc as:

| Expected damage from extra hits                                                                                     |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ![(\frac{1+8}{2}+1+enchant)\*57%=\bold{3.12+enchant\*57%}](/images/math/4/e/6/4e672de7d586ec14754bcbb8f29792a3.png) |

| Weapon              | Small monsters                                                                                           | Large monsters                                                                                           |
| ------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| +0 Mouser's Scalpel | ![\frac{1+6}{2}+1+3.12=\bold{7.62}](/images/math/4/6/e/46e3671b55e69d8de3771771c54da93d.png)             | ![\frac{1+8}{2}+1+3.12=\bold{8.62}](/images/math/f/5/a/f5a85fbf74efcbb45d92e9dcedb12918.png)             |
| +7 Mouser's Scalpel | ![\frac{1+6}{2}+1+3.12+ 7\*57% +7=\bold{18.61}](/images/math/a/9/c/a9c18d57f9c3e5b10a499a9bbc71b5ef.png) | ![\frac{1+8}{2}+1+3.12+ 7\*57% +7=\bold{19.61}](/images/math/1/0/8/1088a414d64942b99b0c2c4f177625d8.png) |
| +9 Mouser's Scalpel | ![\frac{1+6}{2}+1+3.12+ 9\*57% +9=\bold{21.75}](/images/math/4/f/3/4f3fa370861ab17931ab7a293a207a54.png) | ![\frac{1+8}{2}+1+3.12+ 9\*57% +9=\bold{22.75}](/images/math/a/e/d/aed10005e95ba4a8d908eb5f65ad6495.png) |

## History

The Mouser's Scalpel first appeared in [SLASH 6](/wiki/SLASH_6 "SLASH 6") as one of the many "Newhon" artifacts;[\[2\]](#cite_note-newhon-2) it was then known simply as **Scalpel** (not to be confused with a [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer")'s [scalpel](/wiki/Scalpel "Scalpel")), and became a [deferred](/wiki/Deferred "Deferred") item within the data of [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), which carried over its code.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-readme-4) The artifact was renamed and reintroduced in SlashTHEM, which adapted it from BarclayII's SlashEM-Up project.[\[2\]](#cite_note-newhon-2)

## Origin

The Mouser's Scalpel comes from the *[Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fafhrd_and_the_Gray_Mouser "wikipedia:Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser")* stories by [Fritz Leiber](/wiki/Fritz_Leiber "Fritz Leiber"), where it is the titular Gray Mouser's trademark weapon. His prowess in swordsmanship is reflected in its ability to strike multiple blows.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [SlashTHEM src/artifact.c, line 1503](https://github.com/Soviet5lo/SlashTHEM/blob/develop/src/artifact.c#L1503)
2. ↑ [2.0](#cite_ref-newhon_2-0) [2.1](#cite_ref-newhon_2-1) [SlashTHEM commit ef462f2: Revive the Newhon Artifacts from SLASH 6](https://github.com/Soviet5lo/SlashTHEM/commit/ef462f27264bbb56251d37cd0e2be6c0cb051d12)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [artifact.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 1244](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/artifact.c#line1244 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/artifact.c")
4. [↑](#cite_ref-readme_4-0) [SLASH'EM readme.s, line 41](https://github.com/k21971/SlashEM/blob/8d5529799ad7ef36ed1eeca00f67a1d65c8e9c53/readme.s6#L41)

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

Mouser's Scalpel

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
)   Mouser's Scalpel   (No tile)
Base item rapier
Damage vs. small 1d6 +1 + (special)
Damage vs. large 1d8 +1 + (special)
To-hit bonus +5
Bonus versus (any)
Weapon skill saber
Size one-handed
Affiliation
  • neutral
When carried

(none)

When wielded

(none)

When invoked

(none)

Base price 600 zm
Weight 40
Material metal

Mouser's Scalpel is an artifact weapon that appears in SlashTHEM and Hack'EM. It is neutral for wishing purposes, and its base item is a rapier.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Strategy
    • 2.1 Average damage calculation
  • 3 History
  • 4 Origin
  • 5 References

Description

The Mouser's Scalpel grants +5 to-hit and +1 damage, and has a unique mechanic that allows it to deliver extra "attacks" on each hit: these extra attacks deal +1d8 + 1 + <enchantment> to all monsters. Each hit has an initial 1⁄5 chance of delivering one of these extra blows, followed by a 5⁄11 chance of subsequent additional hits, applied repeatedly until this chance is missed.[1]

Strategy

The chance for extra blows to stack means that in theory, the wielder may be lucky enough to continually strike a foe indefinitely until they are killed.

Average damage calculation

The average damage calculations in the following table do not include bonuses from weapon skills, strength, or from using a blessed weapon against undead or demons.

Given unique nature of the added hits, we first need to find the expected number of hits per swing of the weapon. Given that the initial bonus strike has a 4⁄5 chance of no hits, a 1⁄5 chance of occurring the first hit, and the probability p on subsequent hits after that, we can write the equation as:

Expected number of hits

With this we can then calculate the expected amount of damage from the proc as:

Expected damage from extra hits
Weapon Small monsters Large monsters
+0 Mouser's Scalpel
+7 Mouser's Scalpel
+9 Mouser's Scalpel

History

The Mouser's Scalpel first appeared in SLASH 6 as one of the many "Newhon" artifacts;[2] it was then known simply as Scalpel (not to be confused with a Healer's scalpel), and became a deferred item within the data of SLASH'EM, which carried over its code.[3][4] The artifact was renamed and reintroduced in SlashTHEM, which adapted it from BarclayII's SlashEM-Up project.[2]

Origin

The Mouser's Scalpel comes from the Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser stories by Fritz Leiber, where it is the titular Gray Mouser's trademark weapon. His prowess in swordsmanship is reflected in its ability to strike multiple blows.

References

  1. ↑ SlashTHEM src/artifact.c, line 1503
  2. ↑ 2.0 2.1 SlashTHEM commit ef462f2: Revive the Newhon Artifacts from SLASH 6
  3. ↑ artifact.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 1244
  4. ↑ SLASH'EM readme.s, line 41

|cost=600 |weight=40 |material=metal }} '''Mouser's Scalpel''' is an [[artifact weapon]] that appears in [[SlashTHEM]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is [[neutral]] for wishing purposes, and its [[base item]] is a [[rapier]]. ==Description== The Mouser's Scalpel grants +5 [[to-hit]] and +1 damage, and has a unique mechanic that allows it to deliver extra "attacks" on each hit: these extra attacks deal +1d8 + 1 + to all monsters. Each hit has an initial {{frac|5}} chance of delivering one of these extra blows, followed by a {{frac|5|11}} chance of subsequent additional hits, applied repeatedly until this chance is missed.[https://github.com/Soviet5lo/SlashTHEM/blob/develop/src/artifact.c#L1503 SlashTHEM src/artifact.c, line 1503] ==Strategy== The chance for extra blows to stack means that in theory, the wielder may be lucky enough to continually strike a foe indefinitely until they are killed. ===Average damage calculation=== The average damage calculations in the following table do not include bonuses from [[Skill|weapon skills]], [[strength]], or from using a [[blessed]] weapon against [[undead]] or [[M2_DEMON|demons]]. Given unique nature of the added hits, we first need to find the expected number of hits per swing of the weapon. Given that the initial bonus strike has a {{frac|4|5}} chance of no hits, a {{frac|5}} chance of occurring the first hit, and the probability '''''p''''' on subsequent hits after that, we can write the equation as: {|class="wikitable" !Expected number of hits |- | 0*80%+(1+\frac{1}{1-p})*20%=(1+\frac{11}{6})*20%=\bold{0.57} |} With this we can then calculate the expected amount of damage from the proc as: {|class="wikitable" !Expected damage from extra hits |- | (\frac{1+8}{2}+1+enchant)*57%=\bold{3.12+enchant*57%} |} {|class="wikitable" !Weapon !Small monsters !Large monsters |- | +0 Mouser's Scalpel | \frac{1+6}{2}+1+3.12=\bold{7.62} | \frac{1+8}{2}+1+3.12=\bold{8.62} |- | +7 Mouser's Scalpel | \frac{1+6}{2}+1+3.12+ 7*57% +7=\bold{18.61} | \frac{1+8}{2}+1+3.12+ 7*57% +7=\bold{19.61} |- | +9 Mouser's Scalpel | \frac{1+6}{2}+1+3.12+ 9*57% +9=\bold{21.75} | \frac{1+8}{2}+1+3.12+ 9*57% +9=\bold{22.75} |} ==History== The Mouser's Scalpel first appeared in [[SLASH 6]] as one of the many "Newhon" artifacts;[https://github.com/Soviet5lo/SlashTHEM/commit/ef462f27264bbb56251d37cd0e2be6c0cb051d12 SlashTHEM commit ef462f2: Revive the Newhon Artifacts from SLASH 6] it was then known simply as '''Scalpel''' (not to be confused with a [[Healer]]'s [[scalpel]]), and became a [[deferred]] item within the data of [[SLASH'EM]], which carried over its code.{{refsrc|artifact.c|1244|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}[https://github.com/k21971/SlashEM/blob/8d5529799ad7ef36ed1eeca00f67a1d65c8e9c53/readme.s6#L41 SLASH'EM readme.s, line 41] The artifact was renamed and reintroduced in SlashTHEM, which adapted it from BarclayII's SlashEM-Up project. ==Origin== The Mouser's Scalpel comes from the ''[[wikipedia:Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser|Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser]]'' stories by [[Fritz Leiber]], where it is the titular Gray Mouser's trademark weapon. His prowess in swordsmanship is reflected in its ability to strike multiple blows. ==References== {{variant-343|offset=1}} {{slashem-7E7}} [[Category:Deferred features (SLASH'EM)]] [[Category:SlashTHEM artifacts]] [[Category:Hack'EM artifacts]]
